PropertyGroup.Condition: '$(TargetFrameworkIdentifier)' == '.NETFramework' and '$(TargetingClr2Framework)' != 'true' and '$(TargetFrameworkVersion)' != 'v4.0' and ('$(OutputType)' == 'exe' or '$(OutputType)' == 'winexe' or '$(OutputType)' == 'appcontainerexe' or '$(OutputType)' == '')

PropertyGroup._InvalidConfigurationMessageText: The OutputPath property is not set for project '$(MSBuildProjectFile)'. Please check to make sure that you have specified a valid combination of Configuration and Platform for this project. Configuration='$(_OriginalConfiguration)' Platform='$(_OriginalPlatform)'.

$(_InvalidConfigurationMessageText) This error may also appear if some other project is trying to follow a project-to-project reference to this project, this project has been unloaded or is not included in the solution, and the referencing project does not build using the same or an equivalent Configuration or Platform.

$(_InvalidConfigurationMessageText) You may be seeing this message because you are trying to build a project without a solution file, and have specified a non-default Configuration or Platform that doesn't exist for this project.

Error.Text: The OutDir property must end with a trailing slash.
The BaseIntermediateOutputPath must end with a trailing slash.
The IntermediateOutputPath must end with a trailing slash.
Cannot run '$(TargetPath)' because project output type is not '.exe'

Warning.Text: The referenced project '%(_MSBuildProjectReferenceNonexistent.Identity)' does not exist.
ResxWithNoCulture item type is deprecated. Use EmbeddedResource items instead.
ResxWithCulture item type is deprecated. Use EmbeddedResource items instead.
NonResxWithCulture item type is deprecated. Use EmbeddedResource items instead.
NonResxWithNoCulture item type is deprecated. Use EmbeddedResource items instead.
ManifestResourceWithNoCulture item type is deprecated. Emit EmbeddedResource items instead, with metadata WithCulture='false', Type='Resx', and optional LogicalName.
ManifestNonResxWithNoCultureOnDisk item type is deprecated. Emit EmbeddedResource items instead, with metadata WithCulture='false', Type='Non-Resx', and optional LogicalName.
ManifestResourceWithCulture item type is deprecated. Emit EmbeddedResource items instead, with metadata WithCulture='true', Type='Resx', and optional LogicalName.
ManifestNonResxWithCultureOnDisk item type is deprecated. Emit EmbeddedResource items instead, with metadata WithCulture='true', Type='Non-Resx', and optional LogicalName.

Error.Text: Publish is only valid for 'Windows Application' or 'Console Application' project types.

A signing key is required in order to publish this project. Please specify a ManifestKeyFile or ManifestCertificateThumbprint value. Publishing from Visual Studio will automatically configure a signing key for this project.

Target.Name: AllProjectOutputGroups

Message.Text: Remove the temporary project and target assembly

Error.Text: Property GenerateManifests should not be set a value other than true for a browser application.
Property Install and HostInBrowser should not be both set to true.
Cannot build a platform-specific XAML Browser Application. If HostInBrowser property is set to 'True', either do not set the PlatformTarget property or set it to 'AnyCpu'.
The SplashScreen Build Action is not supported in the selected Target Framework.

XsdCodeGenPreCondition.Condition: '$(TargetFrameworkVersion)' != 'v2.0' and '$(TargetFrameworkVersion)' != 'v3.0' and '$(TargetFrameworkVersion)' != 'v3.5' and '$(TargetFrameworkVersion)' != 'v4.0' and ( '$(TargetFrameworkIdentifier)' == '.NETFramework' or '$(TargetFrameworkIdentifier)' == 'Silverlight' ) and '$(XsdCodeGenEnabled)' == 'True' and '@(XsdCodeGenInputXsdFiles)' != ''

Exec.Command: for /f %22tokens=*%22 %%a in ($(IntermediateOutputPath)\XsdCodeGenTempA.txt) do ( for /f %22tokens=*%22 %%b in ($(IntermediateOutputPath)\XsdCodeGenTempB.txt) do ( if /i %22%%~na%22 EQU %22%%~b%22 ( echo %%a>>%22$(IntermediateOutputPath)\XsdCodeGenTempC.txt%22 ) ) )

Error.Text: Conflicts Pre Translators '$(ElasPretranslateAssembly)' and '$(ElasPretranslateMicrosoftTranslationAssembly)'. You can only use one pre translator.
